faqs.question: How do I apply to NeuronHire roles?
faqs.answer: You can apply via our job postings (website and social media) or via candidate form; if your profile matches we’ll invite you to the vetting process.

faqs.question: What are the minimum requirements to join NeuronHire?
faqs.answer: Requirements vary per role. We match your profile to the role’s needs; some roles ask seniority, others focus on hands-on skills or specific domain knowledge. Good English communication skills are non-negotiable.

faqs.question: Where are the roles based? Can I work remotely?
faqs.answer: Most roles are remote / timezone-aligned; some may be location-preferred and others may require occasional travel. Details are always in the role description.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa to work remotely with US-based companies?
faqs.answer: No. You'll be hired as an international contractor (not an employee), requiring no visa for remote work.

faqs.question: How long does the onboarding process take?
faqs.answer: Typically 5-7 business days post-contract signing. Delays only occur if background checks or document submissions (e.g., Personal Legal Entity Documentation) are pending.

faqs.question: What level of English is required?
faqs.answer: Intermediate to fluent English is usually required for international roles; we assess English during vetting to ensure team communication.

faqs.question: Do you offer support after placement?
faqs.answer: Yes, we run follow-ups in the early months to ensure fit and can assist as a mediator if issues arise per the contract.

faqs.question: What does the vetting process look like?
faqs.answer: Typical steps: CV screen, short call, technical exercise or live interview, peer technical interview, English check and cultural interview.

faqs.question: What technical assessments should I expect?
faqs.answer: Role-specific evaluations (e.g., live coding for engineers, system design for architects). Tests mirror real tasks from the job description.

faqs.question: Can I request mock interviews for practice?
faqs.answer: Yes! We offer free mock interviews with senior developers upon profile approval.

faqs.question: Are coding tests time-limited?
faqs.answer: Most are 60-120 minutes long.

faqs.question: Will you help me prepare for interviews?
faqs.answer: Yes, we provide guidance and pre-interview tips to help you present your technical and soft skills effectively. We also constantly post on our social media tips to prepare you for interviews.

faqs.question: When and how do I get paid?
faqs.answer: Payments are usually monthly upon invoice submission, per the contract schedule (typical timing: invoice → payment within the agreed period, standard practice is early in the following month). Exact terms appear in each contract. Payments are made to a contractor-registered global bank account. NeuronHire helps set this up and acts as payment agent when needed.

faqs.question: Will I be paid in USD?
faqs.answer: Payment currency depends on the client and the engagement model; many international contracts pay in USD, but specifics are confirmed in offers.

faqs.question: Do I need to be a legal entity?
faqs.answer: We require contractors to invoice as a legal entity. If you don’t have one, we can advise options, but payments are processed only after required documentation is in place.

faqs.question: Will NeuronHire deduct anything from my pay?
faqs.answer: The gross price in the contract covers all costs. NeuronHire may withhold pre-agreed amounts for vendor benefits (health plans, gym, administrative service fees) only if you explicitly agree and these withholdings are listed in the contract/annex.

faqs.question: Does NeuronHire offer benefits?
faqs.answer: We offer optional benefit packages (examples: health plans, gym) for eligible contractors; specifics depend on the engagement and are detailed in the contract or annex. Benefits and any related deductions are clearly disclosed before signing.

faqs.question: Who pays for travel or expenses?
faqs.answer: Pre-approved business travel and reasonable expenses are reimbursed by the client per the contract. Always get approval beforehand and keep receipts.

faqs.question: What about taxes and social contributions?
faqs.answer: As an independent contractor you are solely responsible for all taxes, social security contributions and local compliance. Tax responsibilities depend on your legal status and local law; we can share common models and connect you with local tax partners for guidance.

faqs.question: Can I work for competitors?
faqs.answer: No. Contracts include non-compete clauses. You must avoid conflicts of interest with client activities.

faqs.question: What happens if a client terminates a contract early?
faqs.answer: You’ll be notified at least with a 15 days prior written notice and we prioritize finding replacement projects.

faqs.question: How does contract termination work?
faqs.answer: Termination terms vary by contract. Typical clauses allow termination with 15-day prior written notice and include remedies for breach (e.g., cure periods, fines for confidentiality breaches). Read the termination section before signing.

faqs.question: Can I subcontract my work?
faqs.answer: No. Contracts prohibit assignment of duties without written consent.

faqs.question: Who owns the IP of the work I do?
faqs.answer: Typically the client owns the deliverables. Contracts include an IP assignment clause: by signing, you agree to assign rights to the client as defined in the specific agreement. Full terms are in the contract.

faqs.question: Will I be treated as an employee?
faqs.answer: No. You are engaged as an independent contractor. You are responsible for taxes, social contributions and compliance applicable to your jurisdiction. Contracts explicitly state there is no employment relationship.

faqs.question: Can I work with other clients while engaged?
faqs.answer: Usually yes, unless the contract includes exclusivity for the project. Any restrictions will be explicit in the agreement.

faqs.question: How are disputes or performance issues handled?
faqs.answer: Dispute and termination procedures are in your contract; NeuronHire will help facilitate resolution between you and the client within contractual terms.
